sentences: Krahv de la Motte oli kuulus prantsuse aristokraat.
Sangaste rukki aretaja krahv Friedrich von Berg oli tuntud oma töö eest.
Tiitel krahv on madalam kui hertsog.
context: Krahv is an Estonian word meaning 'count' or 'earl', which is a middle-ranking noble title used in Western Europe and Tsarist Russia. It refers to both the title itself and the person who holds this hereditary aristocratic rank. The word was borrowed from German 'Graf'. Examples include historical figures like Count de la Motte and Count Friedrich von Berg.
